normalized: the same time.
shinjuku, tokyo.
one could see the figure of asagi there.
asagi had repelled the attack from the mysterious forces and come here.
at present, because the anti-state division act was in effect, requests to refrain from going out at night were being put out.
with more than half the commercial facilities and stores being closed, the townscape was gloomy for a downtown area, and even the pedestrian traffic was less than a tenth of the usual.
on top of that, the self-defence forces' tanks were carefully placed in the middle of the intersection.
some of the people who were walking down the road were uneasily―and others, seeming displeased―paying explicit attention to the foreign objects that had suddenly appeared all over the town.
the self-defence force soldiers completely ignored the looks of people like that, standing without even twitching, like statues.

name: asagi
normalized: this has sure become troublesome.
asagi muttered while taking a sidelong glance at the soldiers.
naturally, she made a face like an ordinary person who harboured a sense of discomfort about them.
due to the plotting of prime minister asai, the taimanin had successfully become enemies of the state.
presently, as the most important figure, asagi was being pursued throughout the country.
asagi didn't know whether the soldiers here were searching for her or not.
they were probably just guarding this place as ordered from above, without knowing the minor details at all.
however, if they received the order once, they would probably try to capture asagi without hesitation, and wouldn't balk at killing her, either.
because that, as far as they―and the country―were concerned, was justice.
having said that, asagi wasn't going to allow them to execute that justice in silence.
when the moment came, she would have no choice but to fight.
even though the enemies were merely soldiers devoted to their duty.

name: asagi
normalized: still, i'm not too keen on that.
asagi jerked her head slightly and shook off the unnecessary thoughts.
the person she was waiting for came into view.

name: asagi
normalized: you were late.

name: dogle
normalized: s, sorry, asagi-no-danna.
the orc who had come along bowed in an obsequious manner.
dogle was used by asagi as an informant.

name: dogle
normalized: you're beautiful as ever!
heh heh… i understand the taimanin-sama has caused a major uproar…

name: asagi
normalized: dogle, too much snooping is unnecessary.
asagi said flatly.

name: dogle
normalized: r, right!
of course!
dogle's family will always pledge absolute loyalty to asagi-sama.

name: dogle
normalized: we would never, never do something like betray asagi-sama.
the orc bowed his head in a frightened state.
there was a reason for using such a questionable man.
because everyone knows their own business better than anyone, and spying on other beings of hell was their number one tendency.
incidentally, dogle's older brother, big, had previously been an informant.
however, big's family had betrayed asagi in a certain incident.
naturally, asagi had mercilessly subjugated big and his clan.
at that time, asagi immediately made dogle, who was equivalent to big's little brother, and his family become new informants, to demonstrate their allegiance.
probably because big's manner of death had been extremely frightening, this orc was usually in a state like this in front of asagi.
of course, because of that, he wasn't an associate she could be careless about.

name: asagi
normalized: so, was the job i asked you to do all right?
asagi asked, after bringing dogle to a nook of the downtown street.
dogle huddled up in fear of asagi's glowering eyes.

name: dogle
normalized: of, of course!
dogle said, and handed asagi a device like a communication terminal.

name: dogle
normalized: heh heh, they're the chinese union's contraband, meaning they're usable on the government's coded telecommunications!
i had a hard time obtaining this on short notice!
asagi promptly confirmed what she had received.

name: asagi
normalized: certainly looks like one…

name: dogle
normalized: i thought you'd say that!
so, asagi-sama… about the charge…?
heh heh…

name: asagi
normalized: …dogle.

name: dogle
normalized: yeah?
gosuu!
asagi punched dogle in the solar plexus.

name: dogle
normalized: oguoohh.
dogle collapsed on the spot, fainting in agony.

name: asagi
normalized: you're selling off human women in yomihara.
did you think i didn't know, or something?

name: dogle
normalized: ugufuee… f, fohgib mee… it huurts…

name: asagi
normalized: i told you, never work the slave trade again.
understand?

name: dogle
normalized: y, yehhss!
i'm sorry!
i absolutely won't do it again!

name: asagi
normalized: your compensation is that i'll overlook your “little transaction”.
if you double-cross me…

name: dogle
normalized: of, of course… i, i'm different from my older brother, big… i, i thoroughly understand… the terror of asagi-no-danna…!
dogle bowed his head at asagi over and over and over while trembling in fear.
in order to fully convey the terror of a taimanin, asagi looked hard at dogle for a little while in silence.

name: asagi
normalized: don't forget that feeling.
she said in a soft voice.

name: dogle
normalized: y, yes…!
i'm grateful…!

name: asagi
normalized: well, here.
asagi flung a bundle of bills onto the ground.

name: dogle
normalized: fueh?!
thank you very much.
so generous, on top of having overlooked my transactions.

name: asagi
normalized: however, i'll have you sleep for a while.

name: dogle
normalized: th, that's?!

name: asagi
normalized: good night.
dogaah!
bagii!

name: dogle
normalized: gugeehh!
asagi kicked dogle's stomach, and furthermore kicked his jaw upward.
his ribs and jaw having been broken, dogle fainted easily.
if she let him leave this place without doing anything, this man would probably sell asagi out to somebody immediately.
for now, she made him sit in the shadows, so he looked like an orc who had drunk himself into unconsciousness.
asagi herself entered a back street from within the downtown area, and, after checking out her surroundings, quickly opened a manhole and slid inside.
asagi cautiously climbed down the ladder into the pitch-dark shaft that led from the manhole.
beyond this point, it was a top secret route, but that didn't necessarily mean there were no traps set.

name: asagi
normalized: the enemy is the state, after all.
once she had descended about 5 metres, she groped around the wall with her hand, and firmly pushed on a certain place.
making a faint electronic sound, part of the wall opened, and an electronic display board and numeric keypad appeared.
then, it prompted her to input a passcode.

name: asagi
normalized: once i've gotten in, i'll end this with a bang.
asagi laughed a little, and entered the 10-digit passcode without hesitating.
zuzuu.
the sound of a wall moving was audible from lower down the shaft.
it looked all right.
asagi began to descend the ladder again.
how far down had she gone?
asagi finally arrived at an underground passage.
it seemed to stretch north and south, but the end points couldn't be seen, as though they both went on forever.
and the cold, stagnant atmosphere characteristic of an underground place was hanging in the air.

name: asagi
normalized: it's my first time coming here, but what a strange room it is.
the place where asagi was now was a special facility, spread throughout with very long network cables that crept underneath tokyo.
this place being a closed network, classified, national defence-related lines were integrated.
naturally, being a facility as good as top secret for the state, it was designed to be unknown, even by the taimanin.

name: asagi
normalized: well, we do know, but…
asagi discovered the cable's relay broadcasting equipment, and she connected the terminal device she had made dogle provide.
furthermore, she patched her mobile phone into that terminal device and put in a call to a certain person.
without even time for one ring to end, the other party answered.

name: yamamoto
normalized: it's me.
it was yamamoto.
she didn't know what situation he was in now, but it was the same calm voice as always.
asagi was relieved by that fact, but without saying too much, she suddenly got into the important matter.

name: asagi
normalized: it's asagi.
i want to know the situation.

name: yamamoto
normalized: the government's secret defence line, huh?
you came to tokyo?

name: asagi
normalized: yeah, they'll probably realize the intrusion in three minutes.
please inform me without delay.

name: yamamoto
normalized: i am now being questioned at the prime minister's residence.
speaking of which, i've been placed under house arrest.

name: yamamoto
normalized: i'm truly sorry, but in my present condition, i can't be helpful at all.
that was as expected.
it was better to have just made contact like this.

name: asagi
normalized: even if it's just information, it's fine.
afterwards, i'll move.

name: yamamoto
normalized: uh-huh.
currently, the taimanin village is occupied, and the taimanin, as well as most of the students, are being held hostage.

name: asagi
normalized: （so it's like that, as i thought… damn.

name: yamamoto
normalized: the ones occupying it look like a mercenary unit organized at the time of the taiwan crisis, a unit independent of the self-defence forces and directly commanded by the prime minister.
its name is the kanda brigade.

name: asagi
normalized: kanda brigade… i've heard of them.

name: asagi
normalized: i've also been attacked by those guys, and they even had that powered exoskeleton.

name: yamamoto
normalized: probably because the prime minister had the kanda brigade steal them from the fuji base for this day.

name: asagi
normalized: i've remembered.
kanda brigade, if i remember rightly, they were a mercenary unit formed at the time of the establishment of the marine self-defence forces.

name: yamamoto
normalized: that's right.
there are several hundred charges of engaging primarily in illegal activities during the war―pillaging, massacring civilians, rape, and so on.
they're quite the bloodthirsty hunting dogs.

name: asagi
normalized: why hunting dogs from during the war, now, at this point?

name: yamamoto
normalized: it looks like they had been posted somewhere until now, due to their convenience.

name: yamamoto
normalized: after the war, they were assigned to a solitary northern island, virtually imprisoned, but it looks like even after that, successive prime ministers have given them dirty jobs as missions.

name: asagi
normalized: those guys attacked the village… what about those girls…?
what about murasaki and sakura…?
yamamoto slightly hesitated to speak.

name: yamamoto
normalized: …at present, their fate is unknown.

name: asagi
normalized: i see…
asagi bit her lip.
she knew, since she had also been attacked.
those “raiden” powered exoskeletons were tough enemies, even for taimanin.
if it was murasaki and sakura, she wanted to believe they hadn't lost, but…

name: yamamoto
normalized: asagi, i know it's tough, but it would be dangerous to approach the village now.

name: asagi
normalized: yeah, i know.
asagi answered calmly, stifling her anxiety and anger.

name: yamamoto
normalized: i think we can consider prime minister asai an insidious enemy.
i had thought he was a country hick being carried on the shoulders of his party leaders, but it looks like that was wrong.

name: asagi
normalized: looks like it.
he's a surprisingly good deceiver.

name: yamamoto
normalized: the enemy's aim was probably to draw you away from the village and capture you, thinking it would make the taimanin powerless as an organization.

name: yamamoto
normalized: what kind of advantage crushing the taimanin is to the enemy is unclear, though.

name: asagi
normalized: now that you mention it, the guys who attacked me were trying to capture me alive.

name: yamamoto
normalized: is that so?
that's strange.

name: asagi
normalized: it is strange, isn't it?
well, that's enough.
i have information as well.
it looks like the american state department is backing asai via nomad.

name: asagi
normalized: and i've heard that, in return for paying asai some kind of compensation, the state department is demanding japan's affiliation with the pacific community.

name: yamamoto
normalized: where did that information come from?
yamamoto asked suspiciously, seeming to have noticed something subtle in asagi's tone of voice.

name: asagi
normalized: the words of a masked taimanin i met from the other side.
a woman using the cicada shell technique.
unidentified.
friend or foe: unknown.

name: yamamoto
normalized: that's suspicious.

name: asagi
normalized: full throttle suspiciousness.

name: yamamoto
normalized: however, if that information is true, the motive for the enemy to attack the taimanin becomes clear.

name: yamamoto
normalized: i don't know what the enemy is seeking by colluding with the american federation and nomad to that extent, but…
the signs that yamamoto was making his brain turn around at full speed were coming across.
he had said he couldn't be helpful at all, but he would have no intention of being captured by the enemy and giving up.
no, he was definitely aiming for a chance to recover.

name: asagi
normalized: （the director's determined too, eh…?
fufu.

name: asagi
normalized: incidentally, director, i wonder if it's okay to call our boss the enemy?

name: yamamoto
normalized: prime minister asai is certainly our supreme commander, but that doesn't mean we serve him personally.
we serve justice.
the response she expected came back to her.
it was a trite speech, but that was okay.

name: asagi
normalized: i'm relieved to hear that.
i'll try to do what i can.

name: yamamoto
normalized: are you going to go underground?

name: asagi
normalized: after i erase all traces.
permission?

name: yamamoto
normalized: understood.
i will authorize the destruction of the backup data.
yamamoto accepted asagi's request right away.

name: yamamoto
normalized: it looks like murasaki and sakura erased the data that was in the village, but the backups are still distributed between three safehouses.
they cannot be allowed to cross over to the enemy.
it was as yamamoto said.
all operational information about the taimanin, such as lists of the taimanin, the territories of their missions and the locations of safehouses, were inscribed in them.
they absolutely could not afford for it to be stolen by the enemy.

name: yamamoto
normalized: we did decentralize the headquarters facilities for when something happened to the village, but when it comes to this sort of situation, it's become a bit tricky.

name: asagi
normalized: no one ever expected the government would attack the taimanin.
asagi said.
however, affliction filled those words.

name: asagi
normalized: don't worry.
i'll definitely destroy the data from those three places.
i'll become somebody who is nobody, so i can hide among the populace.

name: asagi
normalized: until the time comes… there's no way to counter the government and the kanda brigade right now except for that.

name: yamamoto
normalized: that's right.
already, to placate them, some taimanin are demonstrating intentions of allegiance to the government.

name: yamamoto
normalized: discovering the location of the safehouses where the backup data is hidden is a matter of time.

name: yamamoto
normalized: if that gets into the enemy's hands, not only will the taimanin on missions be put in danger, but you will probably become unable to conceal yourself in the streets.
by any means necessary, destroy the data before it passes into the enemy's hands.

name: asagi
normalized: roger.
asagi said, and was about to end the call there.
but, remembering something she had to ask, no matter what, she opened her mouth again.

name: asagi
normalized: director, well… it's about asuka, but…
an indication that yamamoto hesitated to speak came across.
asagi understood from that.
“yes, that's right.

name: yamamoto
normalized: asuka, huh…?
it looks like she's receiving the backing of the american federation.
to judge from the situation, i think it would be appropriate to consider her “the enemy”.
yamamoto declared.
that asuka was “the enemy”.
hearing that, asagi――

name: asagi
normalized: （no doubt anymore, asuka is an enemy of the taimanin.
as yamamoto said, if she was receiving the backing of the american federation, it appeared that asuka was on the enemy side.
like nomad.
like black.

name: asagi
normalized: （i have to prepare myself for the worst.

name: asagi
normalized: （i will defeat asuka.
as the commanding officer of the taimanin.

name: asagi
normalized: （but, can i really do that?

name: asagi
normalized: （to kill that girl would…）

name: asagi
normalized: （asuka is my daughter.
i still want to believe in her.
as yamamoto said, if she was receiving the backing of the american federation, it appeared that asuka was on the enemy side.
like nomad.
like black.
however, the asuka that asagi knew hated black more than anyone.
the enemy of her family, her parents.
she was working as an advance detachment of the american federation, which supported black?
no, that was wrong.
asagi's intuition as her mother told her “that's wrong.
asuka's also a warrior seeking justice.
taimanin blood flows within her.

name: asagi
normalized: （still, if that's a mistake… i'll…）

name: asagi
normalized: …h
asagi shook off her hesitation.
she focused her senses as a taimanin.
right now, she would just do what she had to do.
even if, after this, she had to make a tough choice.

name: asagi
normalized: director, i'm going now.

name: yamamoto
normalized: asagi…

name: asagi
normalized: what?

name: yamamoto
normalized: don't die.

name: asagi
normalized: i'll try.
saying so, asagi terminated the transmission.
immediately after――

name: asagi
normalized: guh!
dosuu!
before she knew it, asagi had struck her fist into the wall with all her strength.
she didn't realize it herself, but asagi had now been driven to the wall, to such a degree that she needed to perform such childish venting.

name: asagi
normalized: （sakura, murasaki…!
the truth was, she wanted to go to the village right now.
but now, however, there was something she had to do.
besides embarking on that alone, it was exceedingly risky, as she didn't even know the enemy's military strength.
to start with, she didn't even clearly know whether or not sakura and murasaki were currently in the village.

name: asagi
normalized: （everyone, be safe…!
asagi cast away her emotions.
she turned completely into a pure taimanin.
what she had to do now.
to destroy the three data backups.
to protect all the taimanin.
